docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Welcome to my corner of the digital realm! I'm Ethan Hartman, a passionate Senior at Rochester Institute of Technology pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science. My journey into the world of programming started at the age of 13, and the love for it has only grown stronger since.

Throughout my academic journey, I've undertaken a variety of projects, ranging from captivating games and intriguing research endeavors to small, yet impactful programs. These projects not only showcase my coding prowess but also serve as a testament to my dedication and creativity in the realm of computer science. Feel free to explore them to get a glimpse of my coding style and the functionality each project brings to the table.

In my approach to projects, I always consider the grand scheme, where every current action shapes the future. My favorite endeavors are those that have a positive impact or can be applied to benefit future endeavors. I find joy in sharing my ideas with others and value the incorporation of feedback into refining and enhancing my projects.

As I embark on the next phase of my journey, I am actively seeking a full-time position that aligns with my passion for software engineering, data structures, AI algorithms, or other exciting realms within computer science. While I'm still exploring the diverse fields within this dynamic discipline, I am eager to contribute my skills and enthusiasm to a team that shares a vision for shaping the future of technology.

If you have any questions, opportunities, or just want to connect, please don't hesitate to contact me. Let's explore the possibilities and work together to make a meaningful impact in the world of computer science.

Here's to the next adventure!

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
In addition to my academic pursuits, I am an individual who values a well-rounded and enriching lifestyle. I find joy in a variety of activities, such as hanging out with friends, rock climbing, hiking, gaming, programming, streaming, traveling, trying new foods, and visiting family. These diverse interests not only contribute to my personal growth but also provide a balanced and dynamic perspective to my life.

At the age of 20, during the summer of 2022, I embarked on a transformative journey to Europe with two friends. This immersive experience, spanning over two weeks, was a culmination of years of hard work and dedication, both personally and academically. The trip not only served as a reward but also deepened my appreciation for travel and the richness of experiencing different cultures. I consider myself extremely fortunate to have had such an opportunity at a young age, recognizing that many may never venture beyond their own borders.

In 2023, I achieved a significant personal milestone by completing a challenging hike to the summit of New York's highest mountain, Mount Marcy. This accomplishment not only fueled my passion for outdoor adventures but also underscored the importance of perseverance and determination.

Looking ahead, I am eagerly anticipating an upcoming trip to Peru in March 2024. This journey promises to be another chapter of exploration and cultural immersion, further adding to my repertoire of global experiences.

In my earlier years, I was actively involved in sports, playing soccer for numerous years until the age of 12, when my team disbanded. Transitioning to eighth grade, I took up swimming, a passion that accompanied me through high school. Achieving a remarkable milestone, I made sectionals all four years and was honored to serve as the swim team captain for three of those years. These experiences not only instilled discipline and teamwork but also showcased my commitment to excellence both in and out of the water.

As I continue to explore new avenues and embrace diverse experiences, I remain open to the ever-evolving tapestry of life, ready to weave in new threads of knowledge and adventure.

Thank you for visiting my website.

docs.title: Exceptional Customer Service:
docs.text:
• Address inquiries from patients and customers with a friendly and knowledgeable approach.
  • Provide detailed medication information, ensuring patients have a clear understanding of their prescriptions.
  • Offer empathetic support to patients, creating a positive and reassuring experience during their interactions.

docs.title: Accurate Medication Dispensing:
docs.text:
• Demonstrate a high level of proficiency in the precise dispensing of prescription medications.
  • Ensure strict compliance with dosage and administration guidelines, contributing to the safe and effective use of prescribed medications.
  • Implement rigorous quality control measures to minimize errors in medication dispensing.

docs.title: Collaborative Patient-Centric Approach:
docs.text:
• Collaborate seamlessly with pharmacists, nurses, and fellow technicians to optimize patient care.
  • Contribute to a multidisciplinary team approach, actively participating in discussions to enhance patient outcomes.
  • Share insights and observations that contribute to the overall improvement of patient services and healthcare delivery.

docs.title: Drive-Thru Activities and COVID-19 PCR Testing:
docs.text:
• Perform drive-thru activities with efficiency, ensuring a smooth and streamlined process for patients.
  • Facilitate COVID-19 PCR testing with a high level of professionalism, adhering to established protocols and maintaining a patient-friendly environment.
  • Provide clear instructions and information to individuals undergoing testing, contributing to a safe and accessible healthcare service.

docs.title: Administrative Responsibilities:
docs.text:
• Manage administrative tasks related to patient records, prescriptions, and documentation, ensuring accuracy and compliance with regulatory standards.
  • Utilize pharmacy software and technology for efficient record-keeping and communication with healthcare professionals.

docs.title: Entrepreneurial Skills in Start-Up Concept Advancement:
docs.text:
• Collaborated with a company partner to drive market and product development for a start-up concept, applying entrepreneurial skills such as risk management, decision-making, and networking.
  • Scoped both the business and technical viability of a new product or start-up concept through the utilization of entrepreneurial skills.

docs.title: Customer Discovery and Problem-Solving:
docs.text:
• Conducted customer discovery interviews to understand customer problems and needs, leveraging insights to develop a business or product concept.
  • Applied entrepreneurial skills to define customer problems and formulated solutions, leading to the development of a Minimum Viable Product (MVP).

docs.title: Economic Viability Evaluation and Presentation:
docs.text:
• Evaluated the economic viability of the business proposal, ensuring alignment with market needs and financial sustainability.
  • Presented solutions to an audience through the development of an MVP and a Business Product Pitch Deck presentation, effectively demonstrating viability.

docs.title: Individual Roles in the Team:
docs.text:
• Presentation Manager: Orchestrated effective communication by managing presentations, ensuring clarity and engagement.
  • Software Developer: Applied technical expertise to contribute to the development of the Minimum Viable Product (MVP).
  • Team Coordinator: Facilitated coordination and collaboration within the team, ensuring efficient workflow and successful project execution.

docs.title: Feasibility Research on Dynamic Augmented Reality:
docs.text:
• Conducted an individual project researching the feasibility of dynamic augmented reality in a factory setting.
  • Explored the potential applications and challenges of implementing augmented reality for enhanced visualization and efficiency.

docs.title: SQL Database Development and HoloLens2 Integration:
docs.text:
• Developed a simple yet robust SQL database to store relevant data for the project.
  • Created a working program for Microsoft's HoloLens2 glasses, utilizing SQL queries to pull real-time component values (e.g., fluid level, flowrate) from the database.
  • Acquired proficiency in SQL, PHP, JSON, C#, and Microsoft's Mixed Reality API, showcasing a rapid learning curve and adaptability.
  • Successfully executed the project despite having no prior knowledge of SQL, PHP, C#, and Microsoft's Mixed Reality API, demonstrating a strong commitment to learning and skill acquisition.

docs.title: Inventory Management and Stock Replenishment:
docs.text:
• Efficiently unloaded trucks and replenished stock to ensure optimal product availability on the sales floor.
  • Implemented strategic organization methods to enhance the accessibility and visual appeal of merchandise.

docs.title: Customer Service Excellence:
docs.text:
• Provided exceptional customer service by assisting with checkout processes and addressing customer inquiries promptly and courteously.
  • Specialized in handling Amazon returns, guiding customers through the return process and ensuring a positive and streamlined experience.

docs.title: Visual Merchandising:
docs.text:
• Played a key role in maintaining the visual appeal of the store by performing floor tasks, including shelving clothing and meticulous folding techniques.
  • Collaborated with team members to create attractive product displays, contributing to an inviting shopping environment.

docs.title: Adaptability and Multitasking:
docs.text:
• Demonstrated adaptability by seamlessly transitioning between various responsibilities, such as unloading trucks, shelving clothing, and supporting checkout operations.
  • Managed multiple tasks concurrently to meet both operational and customer service demands effectively.

docs.title: Team Collaboration:
docs.text:
• Worked collaboratively with colleagues to ensure a cohesive and organized store layout, fostering a positive and efficient team environment.
  • Participated in team meetings and actively contributed insights to improve overall store operations.

docs.title: Western New York Soccer Referee Association
Field Safety and Inspection:
docs.text:
• Conducted thorough inspections of soccer fields prior to matches, identifying and addressing potential safety hazards promptly.
  • Demonstrated a commitment to player well-being by ensuring a safe and secure playing environment.

docs.title: Rules Compliance and Player Verification:
docs.text:
• Enforced league game rules by meticulously verifying players and their equipment for compliance.
  • Maintained a keen eye for detail, ensuring fair play and adherence to regulations to uphold the integrity of the game.

docs.title: Game Management and Record Keeping:
docs.text:
• Assumed responsibility for timekeeping during matches, displaying precision in tracking game duration.
  • Maintained accurate records of scores and penalties, showcasing a high level of organizational skills and attention to detail.

docs.title: Conflict Resolution and Communication:
docs.text:
• Effectively communicated decisions to players, coaches, and spectators, fostering a positive and respectful game environment.
  • Managed conflicts and disputes with diplomacy, promoting fair play and sportsmanship throughout matches.

docs.title: Decision-Making and Authority:
docs.text:
• Demonstrated sound judgment in making on-the-spot decisions, including awarding penalties and maintaining control over the game.
  • Exercised authority with confidence, contributing to the overall professionalism and integrity of the officiating team.

docs.title: Continuous Learning and Rule Adherence:
docs.text:
• Stayed updated on rule changes and amendments, actively participating in training sessions and workshops to enhance officiating skills.
  • Displayed a commitment to upholding the highest standards of fairness and sportsmanship in alignment with league guidelines.

docs.title: Recognizable Project
docs.text:
• Crazy Dice - A tower defense game on Roblox.
    • Spearheaded the entire game development process as the creator, head programmer, UX designer, and sole 3D modeler, showcasing comprehensive skills in both technical and creative aspects.
    • Encompasses complex problem-solving, team-management, optimization, adaptability, attention to detail, object-oriented concepts, and a heavy understanding of positive player experience.
    • Successfully manage a cross-functional team, overseeing a graphic designer and audio specialist to achieve cohesive and high-quality game development.
    • Rising in popularity, with over 30,000 visits, and a growing player community.

docs.title: Personal
docs.text: • RedblackDbTree - A Red-black tree coded in Lua, which I have used in some of my private projects.

docs.title: Partially Documented
docs.text: These labs and projects include docstrings, but no website designated to them. I worked on them individually unless specified.

docs.title: Academic
docs.text: • Smart Fan - A simulated smart fan on a small microcontroller called the Dragon 12 light kit, which uses Assembly and C as coding languages. The main features the smart fan provides are variable speed, timer based shut off, temperature-based activation and shut off, and directional adjustment. Here's a demo video showcasing the fan's abilities and operation instructions.

docs.title: Java
docs.text:
• Student U-Fund - A local organization that facilitates the funding of student projects. Volunteers can either provide monetary support or direct goods and services for projects of their choice. This project was worked on with 3 other individuals. It provided experience with the Agile methodology, and the use of JUnit for testing, along with Angular for the front end and Java for the back end.

  • Jam and Tilt - A project worked on with YKhalitov, where he worked on Tilt, and I worked on Jam. There was no starter code for this project, it was completely made from scratch. This project utlized a breadth first search algorithm, which I completed to determine the best way to solve the puzzle in the least number of steps. The two games both contain a text, and gui based UI. The goal of this version of Jam is to move the red car to the far right column to win the game. Here's a video showcasing the main GUI of Jam.

  • Magnets - A lab which solves a magnet puzzle using backtracking.

  • RIT Compression - A lab which allows the compression and decompression of files in the raw or rit file format.

  • Parking Office - A lab which simulates a parking office who can give tickets to cars parked in the wrong locations.

  • Toyland - A lab implimenting Java's Classes and Interfaces to demonstrate toy genetics.

docs.title: Python
docs.text:
• Average-Reads - A database management system to keep track of books, authors, publishers, editors, book ratings, read times, users, user book collections, user friends, and user statistics. This database management system was previously connected to a live RIT PostgreSQL server. It was developed with 4 other individuals. I created the UI, UI - database interaction, setup the database, and managed the SQL queries.

  • Movies - A project which works with datasets from the IMDB website. This project gives experience reading in the data into various structures and collections in Python to store, organize and efficiently query for different kinds of information relating to the movies and their ratings.

  • Battle of the Bands - A lab which uses quickselect (k-select) to locate the median element in a large list of bands and band rankings, as well as the time it took for the search.

  • Fractal Antenna - A lab which uses Python's turtle package to draw fractal antenna.

  • Secret Messages - A lab allowing the option to encrypt or decrypt messages sent with a given key.
